text: Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, leaves Windsor Castle after getting married on May 19. ( Chris Jackson / Pool / Reuters ) LONDON — Meghan Markle does not appear to be reining in her feminist views since her traditional - yet - modern nuptials to Prince Harry. On her new page on the British monarchy ’ s official website — in pulled out quotes — the woman now known as the Duchess of Sussex says, “ I am proud to be a woman and a feminist, ” referencing a line from a 2015 speech she gave at a United Nations event. Her biography on the site emphasizes her early activism, including how, at age 11, she took on Procter & Gamble for a commercial claiming that “ women all over America are fighting greasy pots and pans. ” After Meghan
